All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Poolable, org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Recyclable, org.apache.avalon.framework.activity.Disposable, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Component, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Composable, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Recomposable, org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.LogEnabled, org.apache.avalon.framework.parameters.Parameterizable, org.apache.cocoon.components.pipeline.ProcessingPipeline
public class XfolioCachingProcessingPipeline
extends org.apache.cocoon.components.pipeline.impl.CachingProcessingPipeline

A light try to implement a filewriter on caching events

Every cacheable response should update a filesystem copy of a browsable site. Do the less as possible here, cocoon API is not yet stable on this topic.

Old files are not deleted, but should be out of navigation. Better is to let user to manage his files, and delete his copy when he doesn't like it (this writer may insert his files in already prepared

TODO: the same for reader

Author:
Frédéric Glorieux

writeToFile

protected void writeToFile(org.apache.cocoon.environment.Environment environment,
                           java.io.OutputStream os)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Here is the method to write something somewhere. The root folder is provide like other xfolio parameters as a context parameter. It's not provide when the component is parametrize, because it allows dynamic modification, and same sitemap could be executed by different servlet context.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
